## GAD-7 vs EPDS

Every psychologist and researcher is familiar with the time-consuming process of harmonizing questionnaire items to ensure valid comparisons. But when we talk about comparisons like GAD-7 vs EPDS, the complexity increases. But what if there was an easier way? Harmony, an advanced AI tool using natural language processing, simplifies this process for you. With its ability to recognize similar items in different languages, it offers a reliable and efficient way of comparing scales like GAD-7 vs EPDS. Speaking of GAD-7 vs EPDS, these renowned scales assess distinct but closely-related psychological phenomena: Generalised Anxiety Disorder and Postnatal Depression respectively. Harmony can objectively compare these scales despite their differing nomenclature and specific focus. By providing a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and EPDS, Harmony makes it easier for you to identify parallels and draw conclusions. With Harmony, matching items from GAD-7 vs EPDS becomes less tedious and more time-efficient. Choosing Harmony is a step forward in modernising the assessment process in Psychology. For studies comparing GAD-7 vs EPDS or similar, it offers a comprehensive database of instruments, or it can accept your own uploaded instruments in PDF form. The Harmony web interface (https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app) is user-friendly and simple to use. With novel approaches such as Harmony, the fields of Psychology and Social Science can look forward to more seamless, efficient, and innovative research processes.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and EPDS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and EPDS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just EPDS into Harmony</a> - compare EPDS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
